hasAttributes.name: amount
hasAttributes.description: Transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional or group currency for the entity under audit. No multicurrency translation should need to be performed on this amount because all transactions are recorded in a single currency.

hasAttributes.name: amountCreditDebitIndicator
hasAttributes.description: Indicates whether the amount is a credit or debit. ���C���=credit; ���D���=debit.

hasAttributes.name: amountCurrency
hasAttributes.description:
The functional or group currency related to
the balance. See ISO 4217 coding.

hasAttributes.name: approvedBy
hasAttributes.description: User ID (from User_Listing file) for person who approved the entry.

hasAttributes.name: approvedDateTime
hasAttributes.description: The DateTime the entry was approved.

hasAttributes.name: businessUnitCode
hasAttributes.description: Used to identify the business unit, region, branch, and so on at the level that financial statements are being audited and for which the trial balance is generated. For example, you may use a code aligned with the concept of a reportable segment as defined in FASB Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 280, Segment Reporting.

hasAttributes.name: effectiveDate
hasAttributes.description: Date the customer declared active.

hasAttributes.name: enteredBy
hasAttributes.description: User_ID (from User_Listing file) for person who created the record.

hasAttributes.name: enteredDateTime
hasAttributes.description:
The date the transaction was entered into the 
system. This is sometimes referred to as the 
creation date. This should be a system-
generated date (rather than user-entered
 date), when possible. This date does not 
necessarily correspond with the date of the
 transaction itself.

hasAttributes.name: fiscalYear
hasAttributes.description: Fiscal year in which Effective_Date occurs�YYYY for delimited, CCYY-MM-DD fiscal year end (ISO 8601) for Extensible Business Reporting Language Global Ledger taxonomy framework (XBRL GL).

hasAttributes.name: glAccountNumber
hasAttributes.description: Identifier for the GL financial quarterly periods. GL_Account_Number in this file must match the GL_Account_Number used in the Trial_Balance and Chart_Of_Accounts files.

hasAttributes.name: jeHeaderDescription
hasAttributes.description: Description of the entire journal entry as described by the journal entry header.

hasAttributes.name: jeLineDescription
hasAttributes.description: Description of the individual line within the journal entry.

hasAttributes.name: journalId
hasAttributes.description: Identifier that is unique for each journal entry. May require concatenation of multiple fields.

hasAttributes.name: journalIdLineNumber
hasAttributes.description: Identifier that is unique for each line within a journal entry.

hasAttributes.name: lastModifiedBy
hasAttributes.description: User_ID (from User_Listing file) for the last person modifying this entry.

hasAttributes.name: lastModifiedDate
hasAttributes.description: The date the entry was last modified before posting.

hasAttributes.name: localAmount
hasAttributes.description: Amount in the local country currency where the transaction originated.

hasAttributes.name: localAmountCurrency
hasAttributes.description: The currency used for local country reporting requirements (for example, USD, EUR; see ISO 4217 coding).

hasAttributes.name: period
hasAttributes.description: Fiscal period in which the Effective_Date occurs.Examples include W1���W53 for weekly periods, M1���M12 for monthly periods, and Q1���Q4 for quarterly periods.

hasAttributes.name: reportingAmount
hasAttributes.description: The amount recorded in the currency in which a reporting entity prepares its financial statements.

hasAttributes.name: reportingAmountCurrency
hasAttributes.description: The currency which a reporting entity prepares its financial statements (for example, USD, EUR; see ISO 4217 coding).

hasAttributes.name: reversalIndicator
hasAttributes.description: Indicates whether this entry is a reversal or to be reversed. ���1���=entry is a reversal, ���2���=entry is to be reversed, and empty (������)=none of the above or system generated indicators. For XBRL GL, this is a Boolean, in which ���true��� indicates it is to be reversed; ���false��� with provision of a reversingDate indicates the entry is a reversal.

hasAttributes.name: reversalJournalId
hasAttributes.description: When the Reversal_Indicator=1, this identifies the Journal_ID of the entry being reversed.

hasAttributes.name: segment01
hasAttributes.description:
Reserved segment field that can be used for 
profit center, division, fund, program,
branch, project, and so on.

hasAttributes.name: segment02
hasAttributes.description:
Reserved segment field that can be used for 
profit center, division, fund, program,
branch, project, and so on.

hasAttributes.name: segment03
hasAttributes.description:
Reserved segment field that can be used for 
profit center, division, fund, program,
branch, project, and so on.

hasAttributes.name: segment04
hasAttributes.description:
Reserved segment field that can be used for 
profit center, division, fund, program,
branch, project, and so on.

hasAttributes.name: segment05
hasAttributes.description:
Reserved segment field that can be used for 
profit center, division, fund, program,
branch, project, and so on.

hasAttributes.name: sourceId
hasAttributes.description: Posting source (code for source from which the journal entry originated, such as sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry, spreadsheet, and so on).

hasAttributes.name: transactionId
hasAttributes.description: Cross-reference to GL posting. It can contain many different levels to identify the transaction. It could include cost centres such as company, division, region, group and branch/department
